column1: Statement and Aims of the Careers Service
Your Careers Service is here to help you with your career decision
making at any stage whether you are a current student or a graduate.
Our activities are aimed at assisting students to develop their
skills in preparation for the transition from University to work.
These are carried out through individual appointments and a
In order to achieve this and to support the University in developing
the employability of its students and graduates, the following provision
with a duty Careers Adviser or a one to one appointment or similar
<blockquote>•  A Careers Education Programme of talks and
workshops on aspects such as making applications, interview skills
and further study and presentations by employers and other outside
reference and take-away materials on a wide range of career-related
issues such as employer and occupational information, career planning,
job hunting and overseas study and employment.
packages and a TV/Video are also available.
<blockquote>•  Access to networked on-line Career Guidance
<blockquote>•  Organised recruitment activities such as Dundee
web access and mailing list for graduates.
Further details on services available from leaflet "A Student Guide
8.45 am - 5.00 pm, Monday to Friday
You are entitled to expect that the Careers Service will be staffed
by competent and appropriately qualified personnel who will help you
in a courteous and professional manner and that the Service's activities
qualities, values and what motivates you.
<blockquote>•  Increased awareness of career, job and related
<blockquote>•  Greater access to relevant and up-to-date information
<blockquote>•  Increased effectiveness in your career decision
<blockquote>•  Ability to market yourself effectively to potential
The Careers Service is entitled to expect that you will:
<li>Attend any interviews, presentations or workshops signed up for
or notify in advance your inability to attend.
<li>Take responsibility for making your own decisions, researching
your career choices and taking the appropriate action to realise
<li>Treat with respect Careers Service staff and careers materials
<li>Observe the terms of the AGCAS Code of Practice in connection
with recruitment practice (available in Careers Service).
<li>Make the Careers Service aware, in advance, of any specialist
needs relating to the provision of careers education, information
The Careers Service will at all times adhere to professional Quality
Standards as identified by the QAA - via Matrix/GAB set standards.
If you have any suggestions, comments or complaints please let us
know, either informally or in writing.
The Careers Service Practices & Provision adhere to and comply
with the University's Equal Opportunities and Race Relation policies.
As a member of AGCAS (the Association of Graduate Careers Advisory
Services), the Careers Service of the University of Abertay Dundee
is committed to promoting equality of access and treatment in education,
employment, training and guidance, regardless of race, religion, gender,
disability, marital status, social class, age or sexual preference.
Forms of unlawful direct or indirect discrimination or unequal
treatment or unethical behaviour will be challenged.
A copy of this Statement of Service is available on request from
The above services are available to students, staff and graduates
from the University of Abertay Dundee and, subject to individual arrangements
being made, to graduates from other Universities.
